Package com.github.twitch4j.chat.events.channel

Class DirectCheerEvent

java.lang.Object
com.github.philippheuer.events4j.core.domain.Event
com.github.twitch4j.chat.events.TwitchEvent
com.github.twitch4j.chat.events.AbstractChannelEvent
com.github.twitch4j.chat.events.channel.CheerEvent
com.github.twitch4j.chat.events.channel.DirectCheerEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.github.philippheuer.events4j.api.domain.IEvent, ReplyableEvent
@Unofficial public final class DirectCheerEvent extends CheerEvent
This event gets called when a user does a direct cheer in an eligible channel for this experiment.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getAmount

      public Integer getAmount()
      The amount of the direct cheer.

      For example, $1 = 100

      Note: this is before adjustment for twitch's revenue split. Use CheerEvent.getBits() for the adjusted value.

    • getSystemMessage

      @NotNull public @NotNull String getSystemMessage()
      The twitch notification text for this event.

      For example: DisplayName Cheered with $50

      Note: this is distinct from the user's message attached to the cheer (CheerEvent.getMessage())

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:

      hashCode in class CheerEvent

    • getCurrency

      @Nullable public @Nullable Currency getCurrency()
      Parses the currency used in this direct cheer, or null if unknown. Currently, this always resolves to USD due to the experiment restrictions.

    • getMonetaryValue

      @Nullable public @Nullable BigDecimal getMonetaryValue()
      Parses the monetary value that was directly cheered.

      For example, $50 is parsed to 50
